protocol_name: Field sampling of root-associated microbes for DNA/RNA extraction
protocol_name_html: Field sampling of root-associated microbes for DNA/RNA extraction
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d44pv","text":"This protocol describes a procedure for sampling plant roots in the field for future DNA and RNA extraction for microbiome analysis. The protocol is deliberately designed to be simple and requires no electronic equipment. Root samples are preserved in LifeGuard Soil Preservation Solution for protecting against nucleic acid degradation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: soil, sampling, root, rhizosphere, RNA, DNA, LifeGuard, preservation solution, field work, plant
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"1mua","text":"Sample a triplicate of plant individuals spaced out a few metres apart from each otherMake sure you are reall sampling individual plants and not offshoots of the same plant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":173,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bqgk9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6BA718EBE18B4C449BA0DB2A9FA8F4FA","id":680116,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4nvpk","text":"Using a garden trowel, carefully dig out the plants while keeping the root system intact (as much as possible, of course). \n ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":88,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fnn2t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":125516,"guid":"","linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Garden trowel","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"http:\/\/amazon.com","sku":"","url":"https:\/\/www.amazon.com\/dp\/B00NG6GJ8W?aaxitk=zUnUfL1iWnHns7FvAXXR8Q&pd_rd_i=B00NG6GJ8W&pf_rd_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&pf_rd_p=3534726502&pd_rd_wg=NI4nY&pf_rd_r=4DETVZEQWE0PYF1HB38K&pf_rd_s=desktop-sx-top-slot&pf_rd_t=301&pd_rd_w=Inkbk&pf_rd_i=garden+trowel&pd_rd_r=8","vendor":{"name":"Amazon","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"http:\/\/amazon.com","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":118},"public":0,"can_edit":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}}],"guid":"D9E199772D874A8986B0925AA3C32C7F","id":680117,"previous_id":680116,"previous_guid":"6BA718EBE18B4C449BA0DB2A9FA8F4FA","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ei0qq","text":"While holding the plant by the shoot, shake the root system hard enough so that all loose soil is removed from it.Take care to damage the plant as little as possibleYou can use a spatula to remove large soil aggregates that are attached to the roots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":114,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"balb2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bl61n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":125510,"guid":"","linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Micro-spatula set","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"https:\/\/www.carlroth.com","sku":"AT16.1","url":"https:\/\/www.carlroth.com\/en\/en\/Labware\/Laboratory-Glass%2C-Vessels%2C-Consumables\/Spatulas\/Micro-spatula-set\/p\/0000000600002ad700040023_en","vendor":{"name":"Carl Roth","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"https:\/\/www.carlroth.com","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":111},"public":0,"can_edit":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}}],"guid":"B20A279F23FB4498A825114562D02F52","id":680118,"previous_id":680117,"previous_guid":"D9E199772D874A8986B0925AA3C32C7F","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dprk3","text":"From the remaining root system (plus soil particles plus attached to the roots), trim a 'representative sample' of roots using scissors or scalpel. It is usually best to trim the roots onto a piece of paper {"blocks":[{"key":"d1ah9","text":"Press the sample a little into the bottom of the tube to decrease its volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":77,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8nn63","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"29b83","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":125510,"guid":"","linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Micro-spatula set","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"https:\/\/www.carlroth.com","sku":"AT16.1","url":"https:\/\/www.carlroth.com\/en\/en\/Labware\/Laboratory-Glass%2C-Vessels%2C-Consumables\/Spatulas\/Micro-spatula-set\/p\/0000000600002ad700040023_en","vendor":{"name":"Carl Roth","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"https:\/\/www.carlroth.com","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":111},"public":0,"can_edit":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"

Make sure the roots do not take up more than 1\/2-2\/3 of the volume<\/span><\/span><\/p>\n

It is of course possible to split each sample into several separate tubes, depending on the specific type of roots, and submerge each with LifeGuard solution<\/span><\/span><\/p>"}],"guid":"B054C0BD95B5434B9A0D7C35C36364D4","id":680122,"previous_id":680121,"previous_guid":"FA1C8188661C4861A3B7DDC658F7C756","section":""}
